inn1.comm: good length outside off stump, with some movement away from the right-hander, the umpire calls it wide, thought that was a bit harsh
a fuller and straighter delivery, Guptill drives it past the bowler and Kleinveldt runs to his left from mid-on and slides to cut off the shot
the outside edge has gone for four through point! Guptill was looking to drive straight and the ball moved away from him a touch, he's scored his first runs of the ODI series
left alone outside off stump
Guptill lets another one go outside off stump
good length on off and middle stump, Guptill tries to force the ball on the leg side but gets an inside edge on to the pad
good length and just outside off, Guptill stays in his crease and plays towards point
on target right away, on a good length and line, played back to the bowler
pitches around leg and Watling closes the face to push the ball towards midwicket as it angles across him
short and wide outside off, Watling stays in his crease and cuts, Kleinveldt runs to his right from third man and fumbles the pick up
defended on the off side
good length, pitching in line with the stumps and angling across Watling, who shoulders arms
short of a length and straight, Watling gets behind the line and blocks
130 kph on a good length outside off, Guptill shoulders arms
almost ten ks quicker from Steyn, the ball lifts off a length outside off and the batsman lets it go again
good length outside off with some shape away from the right-hander, Guptill prods and is beaten
Guptill continues his watchful start, letting another one go outside off as Steyn seams the ball away
tight line and length just outside off, Guptill shoulders arms again
Steyn pitches around off and moves the ball away quite sharply, Guptill stays in his crease and lets it go, he didn't play a ball with his bat in that over
short of a length and wide outside off stump, Watling slashes and carves the ball towards third man, where it reaches Kleinveldt on the bounce
pitches short of a length and seams across the right-hander, Guptill plays inside the line and is beaten
Guptill once again prods forward and inside the line and is beaten by Tsotsobe, who moves the ball across the right-hander
Guptill swings across the line at a fuller ball and hits it towards mid-on, who dives to his right and cuts it off
short of a length on the thigh, Watling works the ball behind square
Guptil stays in his crease and lets the ball go outside off
Steyn sprays the ball wide outside off, his second wide of the game
pushed off the front foot towards mid-off
Watling stays in his crease and pushes away from his body at a good length delivery that seams away, he is beaten
nicely flicked! Steyn bowled too full on the pads, looking to swing the ball from there away from the right-hander, Watling clipped the ball neatly through midwicket for his first boundary
he's let this one go outside off
that's too wide outside off but the umpire does not call it
pitches on a good length outside off and moves away from the right-hander, Watling shoulders arms
Guptill has a wild swing at one that angles across him, that was well wide of off stump and Guptill tried to hit it down the ground, he missed

caught at first slip! Guptill swings his bat in anger/disgust/disappointment/all of the previous as he walks off. He drove from his crease at one that pitched on a good length on middle and off and left the right-hander, the thick edge was held by Ingram. Guptill's miserable tour with the bat is over.
played back to the bowler from the crease
Williamson drives away from his body off the front foot, Tsotsobe drew him forward with his length and beat the outside edge with movement away from the right-hander
he is more watchful this time and lets the ball go outside off
he lets another one go outside off
short of a length, rising into the batsman's chest, Watling gets on top of the bounce and fends the ball down
fuller ball on the stumps, Watling drives past the bowler and Kleinveldt dives to his left to try and stop it, he doesn't make a clean save
Williamson stays in his crease and plays a good length ball towards cover, Steyn's moving the ball away from the right-handers
that's wide enough for Williamson to leave without much fuss
short of a length outside off stump, Williamson watches it go through
played with an open face behind point for a single
short of a length, pitching in line with the stumps and angling across Williamson, who thinks about pulling but decides not to
fuller length but similar line, Williamson lets it go
a fuller ball on middle and off, Williamson moves across his crease and plays towards midwicket
short of a length outside off, Williamson stays on the back foot and plays towards point
fuller ball at 132 kph just outside off, Williamson moves forward and plays towards cover
defended from the crease towards the off side
that's uppish but just short and a bit wide of point, he tried to drive on the off side but got a thick outside edge
short with lots of width, Williamson slashes and gets a thick edge towards third man
good length outside off, left alone by Watling
short of a length outside off, Watling gives it a thump off the back foot but doesn't beat the infield on the off side
too short and it sits up for Watling, who swivels and pulls to the deep square leg boundary
the slower ball outside off, Watling spots it early and lets it go
the top edge has flown down to the third-man boundary! Williamson tried to pull a short ball that angled across him and edged it over the cordon
caught behind! Williamson has a swipe outside off stump at a length ball that's a bit slower, it bounced a bit lower than usual as well and the bottom edge carries to the wicketkeeper
good length and the ball seams across Elliott, who lets it go
good length in the channel outside off stump, Elliott lets it go again. Tsotsobe seems to have a niggle in his leg.
Elliot strides forward to cover his off stump and shoulders arms to the delivery leaving him
defended from the crease towards the off side
good length angling into the right-hander, Watling stays in his crease and blocks
driven off the front foot to mid off
short of a length outside off, Watling stays back and defends towards point
Watling tries to play on the off side but gets an inside edge on to the leg
Watling pushes forward at a full ball that angles into him and plays it slightly uppishly in mid-on's direction
good length outside off, Watling stays in his crease and plays towards point, Kleinveldt begins his spell with a maiden
bowled slowly on off stump, Elliott stays in his crease and blocks
driven off the front foot to point
goes back and punches towards cover point, where the fielder dives to his left to make a fine save but can't prevent the single. Du Plessis was the fielder
driven to long off for one more
tossed up on middle stump, defended on the leg side off the front foot
shot! Elliott gets under a flighted ball and chips it inside out towards the extra-cover boundary for a one-bounce four
played from the crease towards point
short ball, and Watling swivels to get inside the line and pulls towards fine leg
short of a length outside off stump, the ball holds its line and beats the outside edge of Elliott's prod
a bit too straight and Elliott works the ball off his hips towards deep backward square
Watling stays in his crease and inside edges a short of a length ball on to his thigh
length ball with some width outside off, Watling cuts but doesn't beat point
driven back to the bowler, Phangiso moves to his left to collect
played of fthe back foot through point
goes right back into his crease and defends on the leg side, shouts of excitement from the keeper and the bowler because the batsman played it late
played through square leg for a single
Elliott lines up Phangsio and slog sweeps to the cow corner boundary, his second boundary off the spinner
driven off the front foot through cover point
short of a length outside off, steered from the crease past the fielder diving to his left at point
defended from the crease on the off side
played from the crease and he gets an inside edge on to the thigh, Kleinveldt moved the ball into the right-hander from a good length
pushed from the crease towards mid-on
Watling tries to play a short-arm pull through midwicket but gets an inside edge past his stumps. Tsotsobe, who is back on the field, runs to his right and dives to save the boundary at fine leg
left alone outside off stump
terrific first ball! Hits a good length just outside off and holds its line and bounces sharply as well, beating Watling's push off the front foot

caught at point! The full ball angled into the right-hander's off and middle stump, Watling closed the face while playing an on-drive and the movement away from him caused the ball to fly off the outside edge straight to du Plessis, who took the catch at head height
good length and straight, McCullum defends back to the bowler
the ball leaps off a short of a length and sways away from McCullum, squaring him up and beating the bat
driven off the front foot towards mid-on
full and wide outside off, McCullum reaches for it and drives behind point
defended from the crease on the off side
good length on of and middle, McCullum stays in his crease, gets behind the line, and pushes to mid-on
haven't seen too many bouncers today, but that one from Rory is a bit too high
played off the back foot towards point
pushed towards mid-on for a single, there's a direct hit at the bowler's end but McCullum is safe
good length outside off stump, Elliott strides forward and shoulders arms
stays in his crease to defend one that keeps a bit low, gets an inside edge on the leg side
defended back to the bowler
McCullum had to sway and bend backwards quite low to let the short of a length ball pass over him
fuller ball outside off, driven firmly to cover
too straight from McLaren, McCullum flicks the ball off his pads through square
Elliott moves across his crease and is nearly outside off stump as he turns a full ball towards midwicket
the ball rises sharply on McCullum from short of a length outside off and holds its line too, McCullum begins to play at it but pulls his bat out of the way
pushed off the front foot through point
length ball outside off stump, McCullum covers his off stump with an exaggerated stride and shoulders arms
good length just outside of, McCullum stays in his crease and defends on the off side
worked off the pads between midwicket and mid-on, not that those fielders are in the circle at the moment
good length outside off, Elliott isn't interested in playing it
short of a length and wide outside off stump, steered towards third man off the back foot
short of a length outside off, Elliott bends his knees and lets it go
steered towards third man for a single
a full delivery outside off stump and McCullum drills it to the cover boundary with a fierce drive that beats Phangiso, who was at sweeper
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
McCullum moves forward and drives a full ball through cover, he doesn't beat Phangiso this time
McCullum prods at a short of a length ball outside off and is beaten
the first ball drifts down leg side
Elliott drives away from his body at a slow ball outside off and is beaten, the keeper fails to collect cleanly
pushed off the back foot towards midwicket
worked off the pads for a single
driven on the front foot towards cover
pushed towards long on from the crease
played off the back foot towards wide mid-on
full ball outside off and McCullum drives off the front foot to deep cover
a full ball but closer to the stumps, Elliott stays in his crease and closes the face of the bat to play towards midwicket
short ball, and Elliott pulls towards deep midwicket
the fielder at midwicket, Phangiso, dives to his right to stop a firm drive from McCullum

he's upper cut it straight to third man! Poor choice of shot from McCullum. The ball was not short enough or wide enough to carve over the third-man boundary and McCullum was cramped for room as he got under the ball and played the shot. Steyn barely had to move to get under the catch
worked off the pads behind square for a single
played back to the bowler from the crease
that ball kept low outside off stump and beat Munro prodding off the back foot
he strides forward this time and defends on the off side
played towards point off the front foot
cut off the back foot towards deep point
pushed off the front foot on the off side
Munro is caught in his crease by a good length ball that angles across him from over the wicket, he gets an edge towards third man
lots of width outside off and the batsman square drives through point, Smith is not usually a boundary rider but he runs to his left and slides to make the save
nudged off the back foot on the leg side
fuller length outside off, played from the crease towards point
lbw! But Munro wants the decision reviewed. That ball pitched outside leg and straightened a touch, but that can't be out. There was an inside edge as well. Not out on two counts.
length ball on the pads, nudged from the crease through square
driven off the front foot to mid-off
goes back to a shorter ball, makes room, and slaps the ball in front of point
defended from the crease on the off side
it looked like he wanted to whip that through midwicket, but played it towards mid-on in the end
fuller ball outside off, driven off the front foot through point
Munro goes back to cut but is beaten by the low bounce outside off stump
clever shot, more of an outside edge but I think Elliott opened the face of the bat late to steer the length ball past the wicketkeeper. Probably finer than he was aiming for but he's got a boundary
Elliott moves outside off stump and leaves a short ball that's wider outside off
defended from the crease on the off side
fuller ball on leg and middle, flicked off the pads through square leg
pushed from the crease towards cover
worked from the crease through wide mid-on
length ball outside off, cut off the back foot to point
punched off the back foot on the off side
Munro played the pull too early and got hit on the body by a short ball
fuller length on off stump, defended on the front foot
nudged off the pads towards square leg
short of a length outside off, left alone by the batsman
short of a length outside off, cut off the back foot to point
Elliott plays the big drive, trying to hit through cover, but gets beaten by a ball that seams away from him off a good length
short of a length angling away from Elliott, who lets it go
full and wide outside off stump, Elliott goes hard at the ball, freeing his arms and playing a square drive to the point boundary
a short ball and Elliott lets it pass over his back as he ducks
good length pitching around middle and off and seaming across, Elliott stays in his crease and opens the face of his bat to play towards point
played off the back foot towards midwicket
Munro goes back and nudges the ball through square
Elliott missed the big sweep and got hit on the pad, a bottom edge may have saved him? Phangiso began to appeal and then stopped
played towards cover
goes back to cut and is beaten, that was very close to off stump
pushed off the back foot towards Faf at cover point
good length, pitching outside off and angling into Elliott, who defends from his crease
fuller ball on off stump, driven off the front foot to cover
short of a length and Elliott swivels and pulls towards deep backward square
defended from the crease back to the bowler
length ball outside off, Munro stays back and cuts through point
a fuller ball angling into off and middle stump, Elliott moves forward, pushes to mid-off and runs

there's an appeal for a stumping after Elliott was drawn forward by Phangiso's length and beaten on the drive by the flighted ball that turned away from the right-hander. His foot was on the line but he seemed to slide it back, or was it on the line when de Kock broke the stumps? It's a very close call. Extremely close, and the third umpire gives Elliott the benefit of the doubt. Could have gone either way, I think.
defended on the off side
pushed back to the bowler
defended on the front foot on the off side
moves forward and pushes firmly into the covers for a single
Munro goes back and plays the ball in front of point
defended off the back foot on the off side
short of a length and Munro jumps back and pulls the ball through square leg
shot! McLaren drops the ball short and Elliott pulls off the front foot to the deep midwicket boundary, quick hands, he lofted it over the in field
another one! Elliott uses the pace of the length ball and opens the face to let it slide off the bat to the third man boundary
worked off the pads through square leg for a single
nudged off the back foot on the leg side
Elliot seems to have had a nice drink. Clears the front leg, takes a length ball, gets under it, and lofts him over mid-on
short of a length, and he seems to be expecting it, but the cut can't beat point
flighted, on off, pushed to sweeper-cover to bring up his fifty. Much appreciated by his team-mates

is it a reverse pull or a switch pull? Yes it is a switch pull. He has moved early, changed the grip, got a short ball on what would have been his leg stump, and he has pulled it away through what would have been point for four
orthodox, just as effective. Down the wicket, to the pitch of the ball, and driven between mid-off and extra cover. All along the ground
an action replay this time. Three superb shots. This is a four through cover too. Seventeen off the over
no the Powerplay has not been taken. New Zealand are going after everything regardless. Down the wicket, gets an inside edge to a length ball, and gets four through fine leg

the upper cut has consumed the second batsman today. And it's also two in two matches for Elliot. Gets one short and wide, gets under it, guides it towards third man where Steyn runs in, gets low, and takes a safe catch
short of a length, punched away with to deep point for one
short of a length, on off, stays tall in defence
fuller, wider, left alone, but not wide alone to be called wide
short of a length, angling in, defended in front of off
short, punched away to deep point
full, outside off, driven to sweep-cover
slower ball, on the pads, worked away for a single to long-on
short of a length, angling away, beats Franklin's push
driven to long-off for one
long hop, pulled away, wide of deep midwicket for two
Franklin hardly looks he has hardly hit this ball. Short of a length, just outside off, and caressed between cover-point and cover for four. All with the ease of patting a pet's head
short again, but no room, and defended
nearly gone. Bouncer, chest high, Franklin is slow into the pull, but the top edge doesn't carry to mid-on
another upper-cut, but this one doesn't carry to third man
full, angling in, defended back to RK
short of a length, cuts back in to go with the angle from round the stumps, cramps him up. Defended to leg
short of a length, angling away, Frankin drops and runs, and takes a single
looks to hit this powerfully into the leg side, gets a sort of an inside edge, gets a single to deep square leg
short of a length, on off, another drop and run, but Munro has had to beat du Plessis's direct hit from point. Beat it he does
pulled away to deep square leg for one
bouncer, but starts wide outside leg, and he will have to bowl that one again
short of a length, no room, but they do well with the drop-and-run again, taking a single to cover
another wide down the leg side as Steyn bounces again
flick-pulled away to long leg for one
angling in, doesn't make connection, but gets a leg-bye
angling in, gets some bat to it, and takes a single around the corner
full, swinging in, chasing those toes, beats the swing of the bat
low full toss, middle and leg, doesn't let him get under it, Munro manages an inside edge onto the pad
length ball, but Munro is caught on the back foot trying to slog/pull it, and manages just a mis-hit to mid-on
this time Munro gets it right. Length ball, middle and off, he clears the front leg, and smashes this back over the bowler's head
played off the back foot towards cover
that's a slog and it's cleared the long-on boundary! Munro cleared his front foot, stayed in his crease, and swung as hard as he could, carting the ball over the rope. Steyn's length was poor
a fast reply from Steyn but it's down leg side

superb shot! That's when you play the ramp/upper cut, when third man is in the circle. Munro sways away from the short ball angling across him and then angles his bat face, allowing the ball to bounce off it towards the boundary
short ball from round the wicket, pulled behind square for a single
banged in short, a touch down leg side and it's been called a wide
worked off the pads with the angle into the left-hander in front of square leg
good length but the line is on the pads, Munro misses the glance but gets hit on the thigh for leg byes
short of a length outside off, Franklin stands tall and cuts towards third man
strays on to the pads again but Munro misses the glance this time, getting hit on the thigh for another leg bye
Franklin tries to drive straight but gets an inside edge on to the pad, Munro sees the ball going slightly wide of the keeper and calls Franklin through for a quick single
Munro misses the glance yet again and is hit on the thigh for more leg byes
a full ball angling into the left-hander from round the wicket, Franklin clips the ball firmly off his pads but the shot is stopped by the fielder diving at midwicket
Munro plays the ball to long off and raises hit bat after completing the single, that's his half-century, his first in ODIs, and it's rescued New Zealand
in the blockhole from Behardien, at gentle medium pace, Franklin keeps it out
played from the crease to backward point
Franklin stays back and dabs the ball in front of point for a single
on the pads, Franklin plays it behind square
driven to long off for a single
the slower ball pitched short of a length, Franklin gets on top of the bounce and dabs on the off side
fuller and on middle stump, Munro stays in his crease and pushes back to the bowler
cut off the back foot towards point, Faf dives but stops the ball with body rather than his hand
full and straight, Franklin drills the ball past the bowler
a bouncer but the umpire says it's too high and calls it wide
that's a rubbish ball with third man in the circle, short and wide outside off, Munro gets under it and slashes hard, carving the ball over the head of the fielder in the circle
full ball on the pads, Munro stays in his crease and flicks to fine leg
played into the covers for a single
the slower ball is a full toss outside off, which Franklin gently steers through point
Franklin steps out and drives to long on
short of a length outside off, steered from the crease to third man
Franklin stays back and opens the face to steer the ball to third man again, simply waiting for the ball to angle into him from round the wicket and guiding it

caught behind! Munro charges and swings hard at a good length ball and he gets a really thick edge that flies quickly to de Kock's left. The wicketkeeper goes with both hands and catches it. Was harder than it looked, I think. Munro falls after doing his bit to take New Zealand to a score they can hope to defend.
full ball angling into the pads, clipped towards midwicket
strays on to the pads and McCullum glances behind square for a couple of hard-run runs

there's a huge appeal for caught behind but the umpire says not out. De Kock was adamant and South Africa have reviewed this. The ball was short of a length and it rose into McCullum's ribs. McCullum moved across his stumps and tried to glance towards fine leg. He ended up stopping his shot in the end but did he stop his shot in time? Hot Spot doesn't really show a clear mark on the glove but the third umpire has spoken with the on-field umpire, who has changed his decision. McCullum has to go. It did look like it brushed the glove but I can't say there was hard evidence of it. There was a smudge on the glove but nothing very clear
driven off the front foot to mid-off
played to fine leg
full ball angling into the pads, played through midwicket
glanced off the hips behind square for another single
a full ball outside off stump and Neesham drives it on the front foot fluently wide of the fielder at mid-off
short ball and Neesham cracks it off the back foot this time, pulling it over midwicket and into the gap on the boundary
defended from the crease back to the bowler
full and straight, driven firmly back to the bowler, Tsotsobe manages to stop it and he's probably saved a boundary because mid-on and off are in the circle

cracking stuff from Neesham, moving a long way across his stumps to flick a full ball from outside off to the backward square leg boundary. Tsotsobe ends his spell with an expensive over, but he's taken four wickets
driven firmly but the shot is stopped at cover by Smith, that was a full toss from McLaren
the bouncer but that's very high, the ninth wide of the innings

that looks plumb lbw and the umpire agrees! Neesham isn't convinced though and he's asked for a review. McLaren bowled the ball in the blockhole from round the wicket and hit Neesham on the boot as he played across the line. That looks pretty adjacent, the ball would have gone on to clip leg stump. But the predictive replays show it would have gone on to hit middle! That is bizarre. Definitely not hitting middle. Leg stump, yes.
played towards cover
worked off the hips towards square leg
a length ball on the pads, glanced behind square
a high full toss outside off stump, rubbish ball, Mills stays in his crease and slaps it through point for four
a full ball on the pads, slower too, flicked from the crease through square leg
driven to cover for one more
defended from the crease on the leg side
Franklin stays back and opens the face to steer the ball towards third man, the second run is risky but the throw isn't the best from Miller
a fast bouncer, Franklin tried to get outside the line by moving towards leg and chip to third man but missed
an inside edge on to the pad and they run a quick single
in the blockhole, bang on target, Franklin can only dig it out back to the bowler. Rory hurries back to his mark because of the over-rate
a full ball on the pads, Franklin misses the glance but will run a leg bye
too full and too far down leg side
short of a length and Mills pulls it down to fine leg
they run a quick single after dropping the ball close on the leg side
that's a wide down leg side, won't help the over-rate
a full ball on the pads, Mills fails to connect but they will get a leg bye behind square
driven towards wide mid-on for a single

Franklin backs away and steers the ball to point. Mills runs but Franklin sends him back. Du Plessis hits direct from point and Mills is well short. The fielders take their positions quickly because South Africa should have finished bowling their overs 15 minutes ago. But their slow over-rate won't matter if they bowl out New Zealand. All will be forgiven.
played to short fine leg for a single
down leg side and that's another wide, McClenaghan misses the glance

Steyn's missed the stumps at the bowler's end! McClenaghan defended the ball down the wicket and ran. Franklin responded. Steyn sprinted to the ball, turned around and threw. He missed by quite a bit.
Franklin backs away and drives a full ball fluently into the gap on the cover boundary, superb timing and hand-eye co-ordination
Kleinveldt strays on to the pads, Franklin glances behind square
a low full toss and McClenaghan glances it behind square
that's a terrible ball, full and far down leg side, De Kock had no chance. That was miles outside leg. Franklin moved outside leg to make room and Kleinveldt over-followed him
Franklin whips the full ball into the gap on the backward square leg boundary, superb timing
the short ball and Franklin half-ducks
such rubbish bowling, a full toss at eminently hittable height. Franklin brings up his half-century by slamming the ball over deep midwicket off the front foot
a full ball on the pads, Franklin aims for deep midwicket but misses and is hit on the pads, New Zealand have finished with a strong total after a slow and troubled start

inn2.comm: short of a length outside off, defended on the off side
defended from the crease towards the bowler
de Kock stays in his crease and defends a good length ball on the leg side
a short of a length delivery and de Kock short-arm pulls it through midwicket, there's a fielder in the deep
good length pitching on off stump and angling across Smith, who moves back and across to defend
Smith fends away from his body at one that bounces from a length and leaves the left-hander, he is beaten
pitches on a good length around off and seams away from the left-hander, de Kock lets it go
a swinging delivery into the blockhole outside off, de Kock plays it towards point
a length ball with width outside off stump, de Kock stands his ground and drives on the up, hitting the ball through the gap at cover
too full and too straight this time, de Kock clips the ball off his pads through wide mid-on
hits a good length around off and seams away, de Kock lets it go
McClenaghan's getting the ball to seam away sharply from a good length, de Kock lets it go again
good length, pitching around off and angling across, defended back to the bowler
Smith stays in his crease and fends one that begins to seam across him on the leg side
defended on the front foot
Smith moves across his stumps to work a ball from middle stump through square leg
jumps back and across to play on the leg side but gets an outside edge through gully as he closes the face of the bat
defended off the back foot on the leg side
a bit too straight and Smith glances the ball off his pads towards deep backward square
pitches on a good length outside off and seams away from Smith, who lets it go
an inside edge past the stumps for four! Smith jammed his bat down at a full ball outside off and got a thick inside edge. Could have easily bowled him
Smith moves a long way outside off and then gets hit on the pad by a full ball, he was trying to hit through midwicket from a long way outside off
that's over leg stump! Smith moved across to glance and was beaten. Smith is surprised, but that's a fair call
that's been called a wide but that's a harsh call I think. Smith moved a long way towards the off so the bowler aimed a bit wider and was therefore just outside the tram line.
left alone outside the off stump
a full ball around off stump, driven on the front foot to cover
played from the crease towards point
defended on the back foot
de Kock pushes away from his body at a good length ball that leaves the left-hander, the outside edge runs towards third man
good line and length, defended back to the bowler
Smith gets behind the line and blocks
McClenaghan nips the ball into the left-hander from a good length and gets it to bounce as well, de Kock takes one hand off the bat as he defends on the back foot
driven firmly on the up but the shot doesn't beat the in-field
poor line to bowl when fine leg is in the circle, a short ball on leg stump, de Kock pulls it wide of short fine leg and to the boundary
a fuller ball hits the pad after de Kock tries to hit through midwicket and misses
de Kock was trying to drive on the off side but the ball moved into him and the inside edge went towards square leg
a full ball outside off stump with some swing away from Smith, who moves forward and pushes towards cover
short of a length and de Kock pulls through midwicket
fuller ball on off stump, Smith drives firmly to mid-on, where Franklin dives to his right and fields
good length, pitching outside off and angling across, left alone by the batsman
a half-volley with lots of width, Smith's eyes light up - well I can't be sure, but they may have - and he leans into a front foot cover drive and drills the ball through the in-field
worked off the hips towards square leg
in the air but I think it's fallen just short of Mills on his follow through. Smith just pushed at the ball, which seemed to stop on him and he chipped it towards the bowler
glanced off the pads towards fine leg
de Kock has a thrash at a full and wide ball outside off stump, and he gets a thick edge towards third man
strays on to the pads and Smith turns the ball through square leg and times it beautifully
good length and straight, Smith moves back and across and defends on the off side, he was looking to play towards leg but the ball straightened on him
short of a length outside off stump, Smith moves back and defends towards point
a full ball on the pads, meat and mead for Smith, who flicks firmly through midwicket for the over's second boundary
played off the front foot to mid-off

superb placement from de Kock, steering the ball off the back foot through the small gap at point. Guptill is in hot pursuit and he is quick. He dives full length but can't save the boundary and hits the advertisement boards. De Kock didn't have any width to work with, used his wrists nicely
played to mid-off for a quick single
played into the covers for a single
played on the up to cover
short ball, it sits up for de Kock, who stands tall for a short bloke and pulls to the midwicket boundary, he hit that with power
Smith moves across and flicks a full ball off his pads towards deep backward square to bring up 50 for South Africa, in good time too. Watling made a fine diving save on the boundary
Smith gets behind the line of a good length ball outside off and defends on the leg side
Smith moves towards the off once again to work the ball to deep midwicket
a fullish ball outside off and de Kock has chipped it over the infield at cover. He didn't middle it at all, looked like he was trying to hit over the leg side
Smith drives firmly off the front foot to mid-off
Smith moves across again to hit the ball from off and middle through midwicket
offbreak, full, stops a little, is hit back to him
on the pads, looks to nudge it, can't beat short fine leg
stays on the pads, defended to short midwicket
flighted, outside leg, turns away, and hits the pad
front-foot defensive
looks to flick this but finds short midwicket
dabbed away between point and short third man, Guptill's dive keeps them down to one
short of a length, angling away, beats the waft, but can't beat the umpire's outstretched arms
full, really full, Smith's bat jams down on it, sending it towards mid-off
down the wicket, Neesham shortens his length, and smith mis-hits a pull to wide of mid-on for a single
swinging, full, drilled with the swing, NMac makes the save at straight extra cover
nearly gone. Loose drive outside off, the ball takes a thick edge, and eludes the leaping Guptill at square gully
full, on off, but Smith plays it to deep midwicket for a single
steps out of his crease and works the ball off his pads through square leg
played to long on for a single
Smith makes room again and drives down the ground
drifts outside leg stump and de Kock swats the ball to short fine leg
pitches outside leg again and de Kock whips the ball off his pads through square
flicked through square leg for a single
length ball, on off, defended to leg
on a length outside off again, pushed to mid-on this time
hammered away. Smith is down the wicket, takes this on a length, and smashes it past Franklin. Mid-off has no chance whatever
this time Smith backs away, Franklin stays on a length and straight, Smith pushes to cover
short of a length, Smith goes deep into the crease to work this to leg from just outside off
back t bowling the good length, just outside off, defended with an open face
flat, middle and leg, turning towards off, pushed to his left, McCullum puts the dive in
short of a length, turning away, pushed to cover
that might be a first for Smith. he plays the reverse paddle. Full, middle and leg, turning away, and he turns the bat face the other way to guide it wide of short third man
played wide of long-on for two
pushed wide of long-on
flat offbreak, pitched on leg, turning to off, defended off the back foot

that's beaten everything, the length was short, which is always hard to collect when the keeper is up to the stumps. De Kock moved outside leg and tried to pull, he missed and the ball went between him and McCullum for four byes
cut towards point where Williamson dives to prevent runs

bowled him! That wasn't short enough to pull but de Kock tried to, he missed and the ball hit the top of off stump, Franklin's provided the breakthrough. Actually the length was a bit short, de Kock simply didn't watch the ball as he tried to pull off the front foot, he should have been playing back perhaps.
short and wide outside off, Ingram cuts over point off the back foot
good length outside off stump, Ingram lets it go

Smith had given up and the threw his head back in relief after the ball missed the stumps at the striker's end. Ingram pushed off his pads to midwicket and ran. Smith responded. Nathan McCullum got to the ball so quickly and flicked the ball at the stumps but missed
driven to long off for a single
Smith pushes off the front foot to long off
played to point
driven on the front foot to midoff
pushed off the front foot and the ball goes to point off a thick outside edge
played off the pads towards deep square leg
good length on off stump from over the wicket, defended on the back foot on the off side
defended on the back foot on the off side
fuller ball outside off stump, driven off the front foot towards cover
driven off the front foot to mid-off
shorter length with some width outside off, cut off the back foot to point

edged but just wide of a diving McCullum! Ingram half-prodded at a good length delivery that left him a little, checking his shot at the last minute, and the outside edge went wide of the keeper to the boundary
Smith comes out of his crease and plays the ball on the leg side
defended back to the bowler
Smith was trying to hit that from leg stump through midwicket but missed and was hit on the pad
driven from the crease to cover
an attempted paddle sweep from outside leg stump towards short fine leg, that came off the pad
played out towards deep cover
nudged off the back foot on the leg side
fuller ball around off stump, pushed off the front foot towards mid-off
length ball outside off, Ingram waits in his crease and cuts towards third man
Smith stays back and dabs the ball late towards third man
pushed from the crease towards mid-on
Smith forces the ball slightly wide of mid-on and sprints through for the single that brings up his half-century, his second in a row
swept towards short fine leg
driven off the front foot in front of square for a single, South Africa bring up their 100
defended back to the bowler
Ingram moves outside leg to try and play towards midwicket and is hit on the pad
defended back to the bowler
Ingram gets down on one knee and tries to sweep but fails to connect
104 kph outside off from round the wicket, Smith dabs from his crease to short third man, where Mills fumbles
cut to point for a single
Smith moves outside leg stump and dabs a slower ball on the off side
played off the back foot to long-on for a single
played back to the bowler
Smith moves a long way outside leg stump, Elliott follows him with a length ball, and Smith swats it around the corner through square leg
cut off the back foot towards cover
pushed off the front foot towards midwicket, McCullum is pitching outside leg stump from over the wicket, and Ingram is moving outside leg to make room
Ingram tries to sweep and misses
cut hard but he doesn't beat point
punched towards long off for a single
Smith attempts the sweep this time and fails to connect properly, the ball went off the forearm and hit the helmet
a length ball angling into the left-hander from round the wicket, played back to the bowler
worked off the pads through square leg for a single
cut hard off the back foot towards point
moves back and cuts a good length ball from the stumps through point
good length and straight, at gentle pace, defended back to the bowler
fuller length around off, driven to extra cover
played through midwicket for a single
Ingram steps out and towards leg to drive towards mid-off
cut off the back foot behind point
a full ball outside leg, Smith sweeps too early and the ball goes on the off side off the back of the bat
flatter ball on middle and off, Smith goes back and punches through extra cover
Ingram gets the sweep right, getting well forward and making clean contact, finding the deep square leg boundary
Smith makes room and drills the full ball to midwicket, that was a slower ball from the back of the hand
smith moves well outside leg to try and swat a length ball but misses
cut off the back foot through point for a single
that's a poor line, down leg side, Ingram moves across the stumps to get inside it and swivels to help the ball past short fine leg
punched off the back foot towards wide mid-on, midwicket prevents the single
punched off the back foot to long off for a single

and would you believe it, Ingram has fallen off its first ball! McCullum bowled an ordinary short ball, Ingram went back and instead of pulling it he simply chipped it towards Guptill, who took a simple catch at midwicket. A soft dismissal, and soon after South Africa declared their intention to get moving
he's away with a push towards long on
Smith was looking to back away but he doesn't in the end, bringing his bat down in a hurry to defend a straight ball
played towards wide long on for a single
turned off the pads to square leg
worked off the pads through square leg for a single
driven to mid-on for a single
loud appeal for lbw but the umpire says not out. Will New Zealand review, they won't. Smith had moved across his stumps to work the good length ball on the leg side and missed. Maybe an inside edge?
Smith stays back and fends at a good length ball coming into him, he gets an outside edge that goes wide of McCullum and to the third man boundary
defended off the back foot on the leg side
Smith moves across and works the ball from well outside off through square
fuller ball angling across the right-hander, Faf drives off the front foot towards mid-off
defended on the front foot on the leg side
just as the asking rate approaches a run a ball, Smith eases the situation. He moves outside leg to drive the ball from outside leg to the extra cover boundary. Superb inside-out shot
now he tries to reverse paddle sweep, and it doesn't quite come off
he tries the conventional sweep this time and that too doesn't come off, he gets hit on the pad
worked off his pads through square leg
played towards midwicket where a fumble allows the single
driven off the front foot towards mid-on
comes forward and defends a good length ball towards the bowler
Faf tries to steer the good length ball towards third man and is beaten
Faf tries to work the ball on the leg side but gets an inside edge on to the pad
and Faf responds with a flowing cover drive. McClenaghan decided to go round the wicket and angled a half-volley into the right-hander, Faf got forward and drove it smoothly along the ground
defended on the front foot towards point
that's a long hop outside leg, Smith pulls it towards long leg
Faf moves across his stumps to hit a ball angling across him from round the wicket through the leg side, he got an outside edge past short third man
defended on the front foot towards point
Faf tries to work the ball on the leg side but misses and is hit on the pad
this time he makes contact and places the ball through square
moves across and clips the ball to midwicket, that's the end of the Powerplay, South Africa have scored 24 for 1 off it
Smith attacks right away, moving outside leg and hoisting the ball over midwicket, beating the fielders in the deep
Smith moves across to nudge the ball towards square but misses, he swings his bat in frustration at missing out on that shot
punched back to the bowler, Franklin reaches out with his right hand and stops it
short of a length outside off, Smith backs away, makes room and cuts through point
a full toss and Faf sends it racing to the straight boundary with a front-foot drive
another full ball and Faf flicks off the front foot towards deep midwicket, where Elliott fields
Smith goes back and works Williamson's innocuous offbreak through square leg
Faf moves forward and across to clip the ball to midwicket
Faf comes forward and turns the ball off the pads to short fine leg
driven from the crease through midwicket for a single
he's found the gap! Smith makes room by moving a fair way outside leg, and cuts the short ball from in front of his stumps through point for four
the short ball is followed by a full toss and Smith clips it off his pads to deep square leg
short of a length angling across Smith, who stays in his crease and dabs behind point

caught at midwicket! The ball was ordinary, short around the off stump, Faf du Plessis moved towards the off and pulled. He just didn't get it high enough and Guptill was waiting. Faf made contact with the bottom of his bat.
Behardien moves across his crease and defends on the pitch
good length around off stump, defended on the back foot towards point
short of a length outside off, Behardien cuts off the back foot and gets a thick edge towards third man
Smith moves across his stumps and works the ball off his hips in front of square leg
he looked to play that on the leg but ended up pushing towards the off
cut off the back foot towards point
pushed off the front foot to mid-off
Smith moves outside leg to a delivery that pitches outside leg and drives towards wide mid-on
Williamson goes round the wicket and bowls wide outside off, Behardien misses the cut
a full toss and Behardien hits towards long on for a single
Behardien gives Smith the strike off the first ball with a single to third man
a length ball angling across the left-hander, Smith cuts off the back foot but can't beat the fielder at point diving to his left, Williamson is the fielder
Williamson in action again, stretching to his left at point to stop a fierce cut from Smith
this time Williamson's job is easier, Smith's cut the ball straight towards him, three dots in a row
too much width on offer outside off and Smith moves forward to drive on the up towards deep cover
Behardien stays back and hits the flat ball from round the wicket to long-on, Williamson dived to his right to try and stop the ball but could not
Smith works the ball off his pads on the leg side
Behardien goes back and cuts late, getting a thick outside edge towards short third man, who moves quickly to his left to make the save

caught and bowled! A terrific catch! Williamson bowled the ball from round the wicket, Behardien came down the pitch and chipped the ball in the air towards where the bowler would be if he was delivering from over the wicket. Williamson lunged to his left with his arm outstretched and caught in with one hand, bumping into Smith in the process but keeping his balance
Miller gets down on one knee and sweeps towards long leg
that's a poor ball, a full toss outside leg stump, Smith only swats it towards deep backward square leg. Williamson is lucky that did not spoil a fabulous over
Smith moves towards the off and nudges towards midwicket, Mills has to run after the ball himself
superb ball, pitching on a good length around off, drawing Miller forward to defend, and then leaving the left-hand batsman to beat the bat

he's been given lbw! Will Miller review it? He does, immediately. Miller played across the line to a straight ball and missed. He was hit flush on the pad. Did it pitch outside leg? It did. By a long way. So Miller will get the decision overturned. He's played a poor shot and survived.
Miller stays in his crease and plays towards point
fuller ball outside off, Miller leans forward and plays a crisp drive towards deep cover
Miller moves forward to a full ball and square drives to point. South Africa need 82, off 72 balls
a flat ball bowled short outside off, Smith moves back and cuts hard but doesn't beat the diving fielder at cover
Miller goes back to work the ball on the leg side but doesn't make proper contact, the keeper does the fielding
that will take some of the pressure off, Williamson dropped short outside off and Miller gave it a fearful crack off the back foot, cutting it to the point boundary
now he gets an inside edge on to his pad
Miller tries to make room and smash through the off side but gets a bottom edge into the ground
played to midwicket from the crease. Three dots to follow the boundary
a fullish ball around off, Smith drives towards long on for a single
good length and straight, Miller gets on to the front foot and defends to the bowler with a straight bat
shot! Miller's teed off, making room by moving towards leg and hitting through the line, lofting the length ball off the front foot with power over mid-off for a one-bounce four
cut from the crease behind point for a single
Smith dabs the ball towards gully, McCullum runs across to field, and Miller calls Smith through for the single
driven off the front foot towards cover for a single, that over has redressed the imbalance between runs required and balls remaining a little
tossed up on leg stump, worked off the pads through square leg
driven from the crease towards midwicket

Smith moved a long way outside leg stump to a flighted, slow ball that pitched well outside leg stump, he missed the cut and McCullum failed to collect as Smith seemed to lose balance. Not sure if he dragged his foot outside the crease. That was close to leg stump too.
cut hard and through the gap at point for four this time!

that's not the worst ball to get when on 97! A friendly full toss that Smith hammers to the cow corner boundary, he's steering South Africa's chase quite single-handedly. He takes his helmet off and acknowledges the cheers, and then puts it back on to try and get the job done
played to midwicket for a single
short of a length and straight, Smith swivels and pulls through square leg
Miller swats a short of a length ball but doesn't time it well, the fielder at square leg runs in to prevent the single
Miller stays in his crease and uses quick hands to cut the ball behind point to third man
Smith goes back and dabs a short of a length ball towards third man

bowled him! Miller's off stump has taken a hit. He came out of his crease and tried to pull a short of a length ball that was angling slightly across him, he got a bottom edge on to his stumps. Just when South Africa were pulling away, New Zealand haul them back a little.
Mills ends his spell - 2 for 40 - with a good length ball outside off, which McLaren defends towards point
a full ball around off, Smith stays in his crease and plays towards the leg side
Smith moves across his stumps, exposing them, and clips a ball off his pads through square
McLaren gets hit on the pad by a length ball angling into him
what a shot that is! McLaren sends the half-volley on leg stump racing through midwicket with a crisp flick off the pads
punched off the front foot to mid-off, McClenaghan's lengths are not the best at the moment
the short ball, but it's down leg side and McLaren ducks, New Zealand haven't bowled as many wides as South Africa did. They can't afford to catch up now
the extra ball costs a single, as Mclaren stays in his crease and opens the face to steer towards third man
McLaren gets down on one knee and sweeps powerfully to deep square leg
Smith comes out of his crease and smacks the ball towards deep midwicket
McLaren tries to cut off the back foot but gets beaten by the flatter, quicker ball
pushed into the covers off the front foot

Neesham's dropped a straightforward at deep midwicket! He looked so lax going for it. McLaren slog swept with power, hitting it flat and hard. Neesham didn't quite get his body behind the ball and dropped it at around thigh height
cut to backward point for a single
McClenaghan's length is poor, letting Smith back away towards leg, get under the ball and loft it towards the extra cover boundary
played towards mid-on for a single
A full toss on the pads and the call is for two as soon as McLaren clips the ball towards deep backward square
too close to cut and McLaren gets a bottom edge into the ground near his feet and the ball goes towards McCullum
driven firmly off the front foot to Franklin at long-on
too full from McClenaghan, who doesn't look like a death bowler. Smith backs away outside leg and drives the ball along the ground through extra cover, South Africa well on course now
Williamson fires the ball wide outside off from over the wicket, McLaren was trying to sweep and missed
now he tries to cut off the back foot and misses
pushed to long on and Smith will have the strike

Smith's holed out! An excellent innings ends with a poor shot. Smith made room to hit down the ground but got a leading edge of sorts straight to Watling at long-on. He's left with South Africa needing 32 off 26, they are so close but will they get there now?
nudged off the pads in front of square for a single
Kleinveldt's turned the ball around the corner to get off the mark
full ball outside off, Kleinveldt stays in his crease and drives through point
a low full toss outside off stump and McLaren square drives through point
that's a good bouncer outside off, not too high this time, Kleinveldt's pull is badly timed and he makes no contact
another short ball and fine leg is up so Kleinveldt can hook without much fear, he gets a top edge to the long leg boundary
bowled him! The full ball does the job for McClenaghan. It was full and straight, Kleinveldt tried to hoick it over midwicket and missed. South Africa making a real mess of this chase
that's a terrible ball wide down leg side, McCullum leaps full length and tumbles to his left to prevent five wides
full on the pads, Phangiso leans across and clips the ball through midwicket
a full ball on off stump, McLaren drives through cover point for a single
good length around off, Phangiso stays in his crease and pushes towards cover, where Watling prevents a single
McClenaghan may have bowled poorly but he's made a fine save at third man, running to his left and diving at full stretch to prevent a boundary after Phangiso had swung hard and got an outside edge
nudged off the hips towards midwicket for a quick single, Nathan McCullum can't prevent it
that's too wide outside off stump, he'll have to bowl that again
driven from the crease towards cover
that's deft! Poor length from Neesham, short around middle and leg, Phangiso moves towards the off and scoops the ball between the keeper and short fine leg
the ball rises from short of a length and beats McLaren, who was trying to steer to third man
short of a length on the hips, McLaren swats it behind square for a single, ten to get off ten

caught behind! The umpire takes his time but eventually ends Phangiso on his way! Phangiso cleared his front leg and swung hard at a good length ball that moved into him a touch. He got a bottom edge and McCullum dived to his left to hold the catch. Terrific effort
full ball from round the wicket, driven on the front foot to extra cover
Steyn goes inside out, lofting over extra cover, and the fielder from sweeper covers a lot of ground to get to it

a huge appeal for lbw but that was possibly missing leg. McCullum reviews the not out decision. Steyn had come forward to try and turn the short of a length ball on the leg side. He was hit on the top of the pad so it's too high and missing leg. But it's a dot ball, and South Africa need eight off the final over to win.
a good length ball from over the wicket, McLaren meets it on the front foot and taps it towards long on, Steyn steams between the wickets and so does McLaren, diving to complete the second
a full ball angling into the left-hander, McLaren swings it cleaning towards deep midwicket, where Guptill fields it on the bounce and fires in the throw to prevent the second
oh my! He's bowled a full toss outside off stump, that was quite hittable but Steyn was swinging without looking really and missed it
a full ball outside off stump, Steyn reaches for it and slashes hard, Williamson gets a hand on it at point but can't make a complete save, they run two ...three needed off two balls

caught at cow corner! Steyn swung hard at a length ball and hit it high into the air, Elliott came running in from the boundary and judged the catch well on the move. Such drama at the finish. Great catch under such pressure.

McLaren's done it, he's hit a six! What a finish from him, he sends the crowd into mad celebrations. McLaren moved towards the off side as Franklin bowled a short length ball outside off stump, he got inside the line, got down low and lifted the ball over the long-leg boundary. He basically hooked the ball on one knee for six. They've laboured hard over this chase but McLaren's prevented a whitewash off the final ball ... he raises his arms in triumph
